selection_reasoning: Selected the top 2 performers (trial_0_2 and trial_0_10) which are both close to the benchmark and use optimization-based approaches. Added trial_0_5 (genetic algorithm) and trial_0_14 (basin-hopping) for algorithmic diversity, as they use fundamentally different search strategies. Included trial_0_1 (greedy) for its potential - while currently underperforming, greedy algorithms are computationally efficient and could serve as excellent initializers for optimization methods or be improved with better heuristics. This selection balances exploitation of high-performing optimization methods with exploration of diverse algorithmic paradigms.

trial_selections.reasoning: Highest score of 2.5651, achieving 97.4% of the AlphaEvolve benchmark (2.635). This is an excellent starting point and shows the optimization approach is very effective.

Second-best score of 2.5198 (95.6% of benchmark) using Sequential Quadratic Programming with explicit inequality constraints. This constrained optimization approach is theoretically sound and has room for improvement through better initialization or constraint formulation.

Score of 2.3619 using a genetic algorithm with multiple initialization strategies (grid, hexagonal, random). This evolutionary approach is fundamentally different from direct optimization and could be enhanced with better operators or hybridization.

Score of 2.3097 using basin-hopping global optimization. This method combines local optimization with random perturbations to escape local minima, offering a different exploration strategy than pure gradient-based methods.

Score of 1.3227 with a greedy placement algorithm. While currently low-scoring, greedy algorithms are fast and could be dramatically improved with better heuristics for candidate position generation or by using it as initialization for optimization methods.
